#### PR description:
<!-- Please replace this text with a description of the feature proposed or problem addressed, specifying:
  - what changes are expected in the output if any, 
  - what other PRs or externals it depends upon if any,
  - link to any additional material useful to provide a documentation for this PR (slides, JIRA tickets, related pull requestes, hypernews, TWiki or Indico pages)  -->
This PR includes the changes necessary to run the PixelBarycentre tool from the Tracker All-in-One framework for the validation of new alignments. This allows monitoring the movements of the barycentre of BPIX (or any other structure) as part of the routine validation workflow. The outline of the proposed changes was [presented](https://indico.cern.ch/event/1455298/#47-pixelbarycentre-tool-in-the) at the Tracker Alignment meetings.

#### PR validation:
<!-- Please replace this text with a description of which tests have been performed to verify the correctness of the PR, including the eventual addition of new code for testing like unit tests, test configurations, additions or updates to the runTheMatrix test workflows -->
Several results were derived both with the standalone PixelBarycentre and with the new workflow, including [BPIX barycentre for 2024 pp MC](https://cms-talk.web.cern.ch/t/bpix-barycentre-for-2024-pp-mc/44713), and no discrepancies were observed.
Three unit tests were added to ensure that the tool is able to run with different configurations.
title: Porting the Pixel Barycentre tool in the All-in-One framework
